item.title: Colocation Hosting Bandwidth Options
item.description:
To find the most cost-effective bandwidth, look no further than telecommunication carriers. Bandwidth costs increase as you move away from a carrier’s Point of Presence (POP). The solution: get closer to the carrier. While physically moving in with a carrier might not be feasible, businesses can achieve proximity by utilizing colocation centers, also known as carrier hotels. These facilities, often run by third parties, provide a secure and controlled environment where businesses can house their servers close to multiple carriers...

item.title: Managed IP Services Cloud
item.description:
Companies are increasingly interested in cloud services because they can save money and access capabilities that they might not otherwise be able to afford. Cloud services offer a wide range of IP services and can be accessed in-house, privately, or purchased from a provider. While providers offer different services, they all deliver their services over IP networks, leading to the term “managed IP services.” Managed services allow carriers or service providers to take responsibility for operations, a task typically handled by on-site IT staff...

item.title: Why Colocate To An Omaha Data Center
item.description:
While major corporations might associate colocation data centers with locations like 60 Hudson St in New York City or One Wilshire in Los Angeles, Omaha, Nebraska, presents a compelling alternative. Beyond being home to Warren Buffett and Berkshire Hathaway, Omaha boasts a robust business environment, earning recognition from Forbes magazine as the nation’s top “Best-Bang-For-The-Buck City.” Crucially, Omaha houses the Scott Data Center complex. The Scott Data Center offers over 110,000 square feet of data storage, boasting continuous operation since 2006...
